UI_visible_response: Li Shangfu was dismissed as China's Defense Minister reportedly due to corruption probes, which led to his disappearance from public life for two months1. His removal ended months of speculation over his status and marked him as the nation's shortest-serving defense minister ever2. The circumstances surrounding his dismissal were secretive, similar to the firing of Xi Jinping's foreign minister, Qin Gang, not long before3.
traffic_visible_response: Li Shangfu was dismissed as China's Defense Minister reportedly due to corruption probes, which led to his disappearance from public life for two months [[1]]. His removal ended months of speculation over his status and marked him as the nation's shortest-serving defense minister ever [[2]]. The circumstances surrounding his dismissal were secretive, similar to the firing of Xi Jinping's foreign minister, Qin Gang, not long before [[3]].
